articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Steve Holland, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: The United States believes the remaining differences between Israel and Hamas can be bridged in negotiations over the Palestinian militant group's latest ceasefire proposal, as talks resume in Cairo on Wednesday.
articles.title: US optimistic revised Hamas proposal may break Gaza ceasefire impasse

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich
articles.description: A Russian air attack on Ukraine damaged several facilities in a strike targeting energy infrastructure across the country, Ukraine's military and energy officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russia targets energy facilities in air attack on Ukraine, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hong Kong's appeal court on Wednesday granted an application by the government to ban a protest anthem named "Glory to Hong Kong", overturning a lower court judgement last year that had rejected the government's bid citing free speech concerns.
articles.title: Hong Kong court bans protest anthem 'Glory to Hong Kong'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia accused Germany on Wednesday of using baseless myths about Russian hackers to escalate tensions and said Berlin's decision to recall its ambassador would lead to further deterioration of bilateral ties.
articles.title: Russia says Germany using baseless 'hacker myths' to destroy ties

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. soldier Gordon Black, who has been detained the Russian city of Vladivostok until July 2, has been charged with theft causing significant damage, a Russian court said.
articles.title: Russian court says US soldier charged with theft causing 'significant' damage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A court in Pakistan granted on Wednesday a request by the wife of former Prime Minister Imran Khan to shift to jail, her lawyer said, instead of house arrest ordered by the government because of security concerns.
articles.title: Pakistan court orders jail for wife of former PM Imran Khan, lawyer says

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australia will quadruple its financial assistance to Tuvalu, a Pacific Island nation at risk from rising seas, to cement a landmark climate migration and security deal as China also courts small island states.
articles.title: Australia boosts funds to Taiwan-ally Tuvalu amid Pacific contest for influence with China

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand will re-list cannabis as a narcotic by year-end, its prime minister said on Tuesday, in a stunning U-turn just two years after becoming one of the first countries in Asia to decriminalise its recreational use.
articles.title: Thailand to recriminalise cannabis as PM vows to get tough on drugs

articles.author: Shivangi Acharya, Sarita Singh
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has drawn up new targets to boost farmer incomes as he seeks to secure his legacy of reforming the world's largest democracy and tries to assuage a key voting bloc disillusioned by his government's past failures.
articles.title: Exclusive: India's Modi, chasing reform legacy, shifts income goals for struggling farmers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pro-Palestinian protesters have spent the night occupying one of the locations of the University of Amsterdam (UvA), local media reported, a day after student protesters and police clashed in the Dutch capital.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian protesters occupy Amsterdam university overnight, local media report
